speaker: MENAS
text_entry: SCENE VII. On board POMPEY's galley, off Misenum.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Music plays. Enter two or three Servants with a banquet

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: Here they'll be, man. Some o' their plants are

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: ill-rooted already: the least wind i' the world

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: will blow them down.

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: Lepidus is high-coloured.

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: They have made him drink alms-drink.

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: As they pinch one another by the disposition, he

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: cries out 'No more;' reconciles them to his

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: entreaty, and himself to the drink.

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: But it raises the greater war between him and

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: his discretion.

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: Why, this is to have a name in great men's

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: fellowship: I had as lief have a reed that will do

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: me no service as a partisan I could not heave.

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: To be called into a huge sphere, and not to be seen

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: to move in't, are the holes where eyes should be,

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: which pitifully disaster the cheeks.

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: A sennet sounded. Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, MARK  ANTONY, LEPIDUS, POMPEY, AGRIPPA, MECAENAS, DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS, MENAS, with other captains

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: [To OCTAVIUS CAESAR]  Thus do they, sir: they take

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: the flow o' the Nile

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: By certain scales i' the pyramid; they know,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: By the height, the lowness, or the mean, if dearth

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Or foison follow: the higher Nilus swells,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: The more it promises: as it ebbs, the seedsman

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Upon the slime and ooze scatters his grain,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And shortly comes to harvest.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: You've strange serpents there.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Ay, Lepidus.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Your serpent of Egypt is bred now of your mud by the

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: operation of your sun: so is your crocodile.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: They are so.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Sit,--and some wine! A health to Lepidus!

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: I am not so well as I should be, but I'll ne'er out.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Not till you have slept; I fear me you'll be in till then.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: Nay, certainly, I have heard the Ptolemies'

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: pyramises are very goodly things; without

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: contradiction, I have heard that.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: [Aside to POMPEY]  Pompey, a word.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: [Aside to MENAS]                 Say in mine ear:

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: what is't?

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: [Aside to POMPEY]  Forsake thy seat, I do beseech

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: thee, captain,

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: And hear me speak a word.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: [Aside to MENAS]  Forbear me till anon.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: This wine for Lepidus!

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: What manner o' thing is your crocodile?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: It is shaped, sir, like itself; and it is as broad

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: as it hath breadth: it is just so high as it is,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: and moves with its own organs: it lives by that

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: which nourisheth it; and the elements once out of

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: it, it transmigrates.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: What colour is it of?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Of it own colour too.

speaker: LEPIDUS
text_entry: 'Tis a strange serpent.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: 'Tis so. And the tears of it are wet.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Will this description satisfy him?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: With the health that Pompey gives him, else he is a

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: very epicure.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: [Aside to MENAS]  Go hang, sir, hang! Tell me of

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: that? away!

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Do as I bid you. Where's this cup I call'd for?

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: [Aside to POMPEY]  If for the sake of merit thou

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: wilt hear me,

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Rise from thy stool.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: [Aside to MENAS]  I think thou'rt mad.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: The matter?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Rises, and walks aside

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: I have ever held my cap off to thy fortunes.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Thou hast served me with much faith. What's else to say?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Be jolly, lords.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: These quick-sands, Lepidus,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Keep off them, for you sink.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Wilt thou be lord of all the world?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: What say'st thou?

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Wilt thou be lord of the whole world? That's twice.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: How should that be?

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: But entertain it,

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: And, though thou think me poor, I am the man

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Will give thee all the world.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Hast thou drunk well?

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Now, Pompey, I have kept me from the cup.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Thou art, if thou darest be, the earthly Jove:

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Whate'er the ocean pales, or sky inclips,

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Is thine, if thou wilt ha't.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Show me which way.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: These three world-sharers, these competitors,

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Are in thy vessel: let me cut the cable;

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: And, when we are put off, fall to their throats:

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: All there is thine.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Ah, this thou shouldst have done,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: And not have spoke on't! In me 'tis villany;

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: In thee't had been good service. Thou must know,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: 'Tis not my profit that does lead mine honour;

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Mine honour, it. Repent that e'er thy tongue

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Hath so betray'd thine act: being done unknown,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I should have found it afterwards well done;

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: But must condemn it now. Desist, and drink.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: [Aside]  For this,

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: I'll never follow thy pall'd fortunes more.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Who seeks, and will not take when once 'tis offer'd,

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Shall never find it more.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: This health to Lepidus!

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Bear him ashore. I'll pledge it for him, Pompey.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Here's to thee, Menas!

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Enobarbus, welcome!

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Fill till the cup be hid.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: There's a strong fellow, Menas.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Pointing to the Attendant who carries off LEPIDUS

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Why?

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: A' bears the third part of the world, man; see'st

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: not?

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: The third part, then, is drunk: would it were all,

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: That it might go on wheels!

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Drink thou; increase the reels.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Come.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: This is not yet an Alexandrian feast.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: It ripens towards it. Strike the vessels, ho?

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Here is to Caesar!

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I could well forbear't.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: It's monstrous labour, when I wash my brain,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And it grows fouler.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Be a child o' the time.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Possess it, I'll make answer:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: But I had rather fast from all four days

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Than drink so much in one.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Ha, my brave emperor!

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: To MARK ANTONY

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Shall we dance now the Egyptian Bacchanals,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: And celebrate our drink?

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Let's ha't, good soldier.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Come, let's all take hands,

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: Till that the conquering wine hath steep'd our sense

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: In soft and delicate Lethe.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: All take hands.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Make battery to our ears with the loud music:

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The while I'll place you: then the boy shall sing;

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: The holding every man shall bear as loud

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: As his strong sides can volley.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Music plays. DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS places them hand in hand

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: THE SONG.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Come, thou monarch of the vine,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Plumpy Bacchus with pink eyne!

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: In thy fats our cares be drown'd,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: With thy grapes our hairs be crown'd:

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Cup us, till the world go round,

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Cup us, till the world go round!

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: What would you more? Pompey, good night. Good brother,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Let me request you off: our graver business

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Frowns at this levity. Gentle lords, let's part;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: You see we have burnt our cheeks: strong Enobarb

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Is weaker than the wine; and mine own tongue

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Splits what it speaks: the wild disguise hath almost

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Antick'd us all. What needs more words? Good night.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Good Antony, your hand.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: I'll try you on the shore.

speaker: MARK ANTONY
text_entry: And shall, sir; give's your hand.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: O Antony,

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: You have my father's house,--But, what? we are friends.

speaker: POMPEY
text_entry: Come, down into the boat.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Take heed you fall not.

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Exeunt all but DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS and MENAS

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Menas, I'll not on shore.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: No, to my cabin.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: These drums! these trumpets, flutes! what!

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Let Neptune hear we bid a loud farewell

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: To these great fellows: sound and be hang'd, sound out!

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Sound a flourish, with drums

speaker: DOMITIUS ENOBARBUS
text_entry: Ho! says a' There's my cap.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Ho! Noble captain, come.

speaker: MENAS
text_entry: Exeunt
